p: Occurrence data of the dominant Anopheles vectors in Europe come from the distribution maps of Sinka et al. [ 5]. These authors used the Malaria Atlas Project library, a literature research and expert opinion maps to produce maps of Anopheles occurrences. Occurrence data refer basically to the period 1985–2009. The presence-absence information of the six Anopheles vectors ( An. atroparvus, An. labranchiae, An. messeae, An. sacharovi, An. sergentii and An. superpictus), which is provided as Shapefiles in the electronic supplementary material of Sinka et al. [ 5], was rasterized to a 0.25° resolution to match the grid resolution of the observation-based climate data.
